alert.note: Alert for Greater Vancouver Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 24 at 11:57AM PST until December 24 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulation of a light glaze to one tenth of an inch. Localized ice accumulations of one quarter inch or more are possible east of Interstate 205. * WHERE...In Oregon, Greater Portland Metro Area. In Washington, Greater Vancouver Area. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will slowly warm throughout the day, with areas near the Columbia Gorge likely to be the last to warm above freezing this afternoon or possibly later. Even as temperatures climb above freezing, travel may still be difficult due to slush as snow and ice slowly melt off the roads.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
